question_text: A 62-year-old woman is evaluated for an enlarged and erythematous right breast. The right axilla demonstrates a linear, firm, and mobile structure extending distally down the arm.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: This patient has axillary vein thrombosis (Option B) as a sequelae of inflammatory breast cancer. Thrombosis of the large veins of the chest and proximal upper extremity may occur as a result of malignancy, thoracic outlet obstruction, and Paget-Schroetter syndrome. It may also present as a complication of an intravenous catheter or pacemaker. This patient has a palpable cord in the region of the axillary vein in the setting of likely inflammatory breast cancer, suggestive of axillary vein thrombosis.
